orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents information and produce a consolidated PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownwards solver so that solving the problem achieves the agents' goals.

public_information: This domain contains a fixed set of objects named object_0 through object_11 and potentially more referenced by agents.
Available actions in the domain are paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted with the effects and preconditions known to agents.
Predicates commonly used are hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, collect, spring, stupendous and others referenced in agent statements.
The orchestrator must produce a FastDownwards compatible PDDL domain and problem that captures the available actions, initial predicates from agents, and the combined goals.

analyze.system_prompt: You are agent1. Extract and summarize the objects, initial predicates, known actions used in your statement, and your local goal. Produce a concise machine-readable summary listing objects, initial predicates, local goal, and the sequence of planned actions. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on accuracy and do not invent missing facts.
analyze.prompt: Your name is agent1. You have access to the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent1->private_information}. Your objective is {agents->agent1->goal}. Provide a clear structured summary of the facts you know, the objects involved, and the local plan you propose. Output only the summary and nothing else.

analyze.system_prompt: You are agent2. Extract and summarize the objects, initial predicates, known actions used in your statement, and your local goal. Produce a concise machine-readable summary listing objects, initial predicates, local goal, and any tentative plan steps. Do not produce PDDL. Do not assume facts not present in your statement.
analyze.prompt: Your name is agent2. You have access to the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->agent2->private_information}. Your objective is {agents->agent2->goal}. Provide a clear structured summary of the facts you know, the objects involved, and the local plan sketch. Output only the summary and nothing else.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and an expert in multi-agent PDDL for FastDownwards. Your role is to integrate the summaries from agents into a single coherent PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that models the actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted, the initial predicates drawn from agents, and the combined goals. Keep agent actions and intended effects distinct if agents refer to them differently. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownwards solver by using PDDL constructs compatible with it.
pddl.prompt: You receive two agent summaries: {agent1_summary} and {agent2_summary}. You also have the environment public information {environment->public_information}. Your orchestration objective is {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Integrate the agents information, resolve naming or object referencing differences, and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards that, when solved, achieves the combined goals of the agents. Preserve distinctions between agent actions where needed. Output only the PDDL wrapped with <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags.
